item.title: Sandy add a quote by John Steinbeck
item.description: "I believe a strong woman may be stronger than a man, particularly if she happens to have love in her heart. I guess a loving woman is indestructible." -- John Steinbeck

item.title: Sandy add a quote by John Steinbeck
item.description: "I wonder how many people I've looked at all my life and never seen." -- John Steinbeck

item.title: Sandy add a quote by John Steinbeck
item.description: "All war is a symptom of man's failure as a thinking animal." -- John Steinbeck

item.title: Sandy add a quote by John Steinbeck
item.description: "No man really knows about other human beings. The best he can do is to suppose that they are like himself." -- John Steinbeck

item.title: Sandy add a quote by John Steinbeck
item.description: "Try to understand men. If you understand each other you will be kind to each other. Knowing a man well never leads to hate and almost always leads to love." -- John Steinbeck

item.title: Sandy add a quote by John Steinbeck
item.description: "Ideas are like rabbits. You get a couple and learn how to handle them, and pretty soon you have a dozen." -- John Steinbeck

item.title: Sandy add a quote by John Steinbeck
item.description: "When two people meet, each one is changed by the other so you've got two new people." -- John Steinbeck

item.title: Sandy add a quote by John Steinbeck
item.description: "Anything that just costs money is cheap." -- John Steinbeck

item.title: Sandy add a quote by John Steinbeck
item.description: "The quality of owning freezes you forever in "I," and cuts you off forever from the "we." -- John Steinbeck

item.title: Sandy add a quote by John Steinbeck
item.description: "I guess I'm trying to say, Grab anything that goes by. It may not come around again." -- John Steinbeck

item.title: Sandy add a quote by John Steinbeck
item.description: "How can we live without our lives? How will we know it's us without our past?" -- John Steinbeck
